page.title: 11Mediaeval Coventry.
page.content: Holy Trinity Church is about 5OO years old. After the Second World War two damaged windows were replaced. On each wall there are four big windows telling the story of Jesus. The roof, supported by tall arched columns has beautiful shapes and pictures of angels. St. Mary's Hall, also mediaeval, contains a tapestry woven around 1485 specially for Henry VII's visit to Coventry. This shows saints and other important people and was removed during W.W.2. and replaced afterwards. Carvings of animals cover the Guildmaster's chair now used by the Mayor. The city treasury was in Caesar's Tower. The door to the room and the treasure chest each have 3 locks, 3 people had to be present to obtain money.
